website_summaries.verdict: Don't let the issues with the bindings stop you from considering this snowboard – the company guarantees satisfaction which adds to this option's value.
pros: This snowboard is a good choice for older kids who are ready to advance from the basics to taking some air, since this is made for ages 9 and up
Backed by a limited lifetime warranty
cons: Bindings could be sturdier and don't provide a good fit for all kids, especially those with smaller feet

customer_reviews.title: Broke within minutes of trying
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this before Christmas but didn't give it to my son until his birthday yesterday. Within 5 minutes of using it, one of the foot brackets broke and now he can't use it at all. Unfortunately, my return window closed on 1/31 so now I'm stuck with a $50 piece of plastic that doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: marsmana

customer_reviews.title: An insult to snowboards.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our toddler son hoping that he can learn to ride like mom and dad. Immediately upon unboxing we realized that this was more of a novelty item instead of an actual snowboard. The “board” itself was more of an inflated length of plastic. The “bindings” were so flimsy and large. No child’s foot would be able to fit in this thing. As for those who want this as a serious learning board for anyone over the age of three, do yourself a favor and purchase a real snowboard— which is what we plan to do.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of A Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for my 4 and 6 year olds. They are both tall for their age. Pretty durable. The bindings require adult assistance but work well. The kids love it. I am not sure I would trust it out on a mountain, but on neighborhood hills for practice it works great.
customer_reviews.author: erin van beek

customer_reviews.title: its okay, great value.
customer_reviews.text: nice board for the money, my grandkids love them. Watch the bindings they come loose quickly. Keep them tight or you will loose the screws and consequently the use of the board as a stand up board.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Galloway

customer_reviews.title: My grandson was disappointed that it didn't work the way it should have
customer_reviews.text: My grandson was disappointed that it didn't work the way it should have! He's only 7 and weighs about 50 lbs .. it should have flowed easily down the snow slopes/hills .. but it didn't. I feel it was more for show than to actually ride. I bought two others that were not the lucky brand and they work better than this one and they were a less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: needed some modifications
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 year old. It was a good size for him. The bindings were really big and we needed to modify them so his boots wouldn't slip out. Once modified it was worked great. A nice board for him to learn the basics.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: This was a xmas gift for my dtr. It is worth the price but I am not expecting it to last the entire winter season.
customer_reviews.author: WY

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to fit my sons shoe size in the binding. He wears a kids size 4. Other than that I would have given it a 5 star
customer_reviews.author: Eugenia Kittredge

customer_reviews.title: ... for my daughter (10 year old) and we had great success! Great for a beginner and get the ...
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present for my daughter (10 year old) and we had great success! Great for a beginner and get the feel of snowboarding. It gave her the confidence she needed to hit the big slopes.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M Maise

customer_reviews.title: Just no...
customer_reviews.text: ordered twice, gotten broken binding twice. don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: SEN

customer_reviews.title: Great for backyard beginners
customer_reviews.text: This isn't something I send my kids to the MT with, but it's perfect for them both ages 6 & 9 to learn a home. I'm pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Peters

customer_reviews.title: Ok for under 10
customer_reviews.text: The stickers were already peeling off when we opened it. His snow boots won't fit in the bindings, so he had to wear his tennis shoes. I think for a little kid it would be find, but a 10 year old is not a good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Satterfield

customer_reviews.title: Fun but Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Was super fun for my son when he got it, but the binding broke on the first use. Was even more disappointed when we contacted the seller and they offered no assistance. Wish we could simply get a new binding to replace the broken one. I don't really want to send it back and wait for a new one when my son really wants to ride it.
customer_reviews.author: Jody M. Mentele

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the green one as a gift for my nephew and he absolutely loves it. He lives in Michigan so the weather has been perfect for this toy. This is durable enough to stand up to the rigorous use from a 9 year old boy.
customer_reviews.author: MrsJ

customer_reviews.title: Great breginners board
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a birthday present for my 11 year old son and he had a smile from ear to ear. perfect beginners board!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: My grandchildren love this snowboard
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren love this snowboard. It gets lots of use in Colorado! Turned out to be an excellent gift. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: P. Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner board. The kids loved it. Sturdy, great strong material, and the kids could maneuver easily. My kids are 7 and 5.
customer_reviews.author: Diana B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are fun and great to see if the kids are interested in more serious stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandra

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and may consisder buying one for my granddaughter .
customer_reviews.author: Debracrites

customer_reviews.title: Cute as hell. Bindings have ratchet straps similar to ...
customer_reviews.text: Cute as hell. Bindings have ratchet straps similar to real ones. Foot positions and angles are not adjustable and you can't switch it to goofy foot, but really its just a sled and a cute approximation of a snowboard for a little girl...it fits the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Zaphod Beeblebrox

customer_reviews.title: Bad product. Broken bindings
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Bindings broke the first day it was used by my 6 yr old. Waste of money and a bad gift for my kid.
customer_reviews.author: Joel John Barchini

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter fell in love with it the minute she opened it.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not proportioned right
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said board is sized for a three year old bindings are sized for a teenager. Not sure who this works for.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Nice sized board but the bindings didn't even hold up ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice sized board but the bindings didn't even hold up 1 day. If they made a more durable binding I would give it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Ron V.

customer_reviews.title: Good for playing in the yard
customer_reviews.text: I bough these for my seven year old granddaughter. We don't have ski slopes but we do have hills. They work ideal for her--and her younger brother. I have not heard any negative comments from the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Cow Farmer

customer_reviews.title: It looked like it was crimped at the factory to many times ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the bindings would not hold at all. It looked like it was crimped at the factory to many times which rounded the ratchet strap. Othere then that it was a good broad but I did have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Allred

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it will be great for our 7 year old nephew. Appears to be sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: My 8 year old grandson loved this gift
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old grandson loved this gift!! Perfect precursor to a real snowboard it is easy on and off, worked well with regular snow boots and made very well!! Would definately recommend !
customer_reviews.author: Carol Hughes

customer_reviews.title: The plastic on the heal broke the second time down ...
customer_reviews.text: The plastic on the heal broke the second time down the hill in our backyard. It is still usable, but expected it to last longer. My son enjoys it though.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Laflamme

customer_reviews.title: Foot buckles too small to accommodate snow boots.
customer_reviews.text: Foot buckles too small to accommodate snow boots. Actually broke one of the buckles during one of my son's first uses of the snowboard
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Work great but a size bigger than what it recommended
customer_reviews.author: peter onso

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!! but delivered with a broken piece.
customer_reviews.text: Received this today and my daughter was so excited! Unfortunately the binding backing is broken. Hoping we can send back and get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old granddaughter says it's easy for tricks cause it's lightweight!!
customer_reviews.author: gswindell

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!! Literally
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed!! Literally, once down the hill and the pretty sticker on the back came off! Very dissapointing for my 8 year old!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Nice beginner board
customer_reviews.text: Nice beginner board, but one of the bindings had a crack in the back of it. Still works, but a little disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Straps break too easy
customer_reviews.text: The first time we tried it the straps broke and continued to break as we took the boot off. d
customer_reviews.author: Talaan

customer_reviews.title: This is a great starter snowboard to use in the backyard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter snowboard to use in the backyard. My 6 year old loves it! Good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Product
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered damaged, the boot is broken and unable to be properly used. This is extremely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: CoBoFu

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit snow boots
customer_reviews.text: Got these boards for my boys to use in our backyard. Had to cut off the plastic foot straps because their snow boots, once in, we too difficult to get out of and walk up the slope in our yard. Once I cut them off, the experience was better.
customer_reviews.author: CD3

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: I received the snowboard quickly which was a big plus. But because of where we live in not too sure when my son will have a chance to use it. That all depends on Mother Nature. That's the main reason for only 4 stars. I am a lil concerned that the bindings may not hold up to the pounding of boy's at play but I will reserve that until he has a chance to use it.
customer_reviews.author: robinpowell

customer_reviews.title: Not for kids(and definitely not for adults)
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking of buying this for a small child don't, the bindings are built for adult sized feet and are not very adjustable If you are thinking of buying this for an adult don't. The board is way too small for an adult and due to the materials and given the way the bings are attached it doesnt slide very well.
customer_reviews.author: NotTheMomma

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: was a good high quality product for the beginner,would buy another
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL BRAGG

customer_reviews.title: Truly plastic!
customer_reviews.text: First time trying it out the shoe bindings broke before my son made it to the hill in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish it worked better...
customer_reviews.text: Was really hoping this would work well for my 9 year old on small hills near our home. The plastic seems thick and durable but it would not move! We waxed it and still had no luck. :( We had a cheaper one that we'd passed down to his brother that worked much better.
customer_reviews.author: garlic gal

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool. Our son will be happy on Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Received it quickly. Looks cool. Our son will be happy on Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect first board for 7-year old in the backyard or small hills.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney F.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to learn snowboarding or just have fun in the yard
customer_reviews.text: It looks better than the picture, new graphics, got a blue and a green one also, kids LOVE them for practicing in the yard
customer_reviews.author: richterd

customer_reviews.title: The bindings are tiny and hard plastic. Had to ...
customer_reviews.text: The bindings are tiny and hard plastic. Had to return the boards because they would not fit my kids feet with boots on. Kids are 13 and 11 with average size feet. I give it one star because there was no info about the size of the bindings. Once again Amazon was top notch for returns.
customer_reviews.author: DBT

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough for a 6 year old
customer_reviews.text: Much easier than I thought for my 6 year old to do alone. Slides well, and my kid loves it. Great way to teach him balance before a real board.
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: Fun Snowboard
customer_reviews.text: My son, who is 7, is enjoying his new snowboard. His younger brother received a less expensive snow board and the Lucky Bums board is much nicer and works much better. My son wears a size four boot and they are a little hard to fit into the binding. I do not think that you would be able to use this board if you wore boots that were any larger.
customer_reviews.author: amaznShopper

customer_reviews.title: My Two Boys are Lucky Bums
customer_reviews.text: We got 2 Snowboards for our boys for Christmas. What a Hit!! The stickers didn't fair so well. But the boards are Great!
customer_reviews.author: Picknspray

customer_reviews.title: Great kids beginner snowboard
customer_reviews.text: Great little plastic snowboard for kids to learn on. Bindings are easy to use for older kids, the younger ones may have some trouble with them ? It's great looking (graphics are better than the picture shown) and a lot of fun, kids love it !
customer_reviews.author: richterd

customer_reviews.title: ... exactly what we thought it would be - a great starter board for backyard and local community park hills
customer_reviews.text: This snowboard is exactly what we thought it would be - a great starter board for backyard and local community park hills. It hasn't snowed yet, so We haven't used it - but it seems to be a good little plastic backyard board.
customer_reviews.author: jax

customer_reviews.title: Looks cute
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5 year old granddaughter for Christmas because it was on her wish list. It looks cute but it is obvious the sticker decorations will not last long. The packaging was a bit strange. It came in a box large enough for about 10 of them with no packaging inside to keep it from rattling around .......... well, more than rattling. I was shocked when I opened it that it was still in one piece. I probably would not buy this item again. Quality vs. Cost doesn't seem equal. Time will tell ~ after she takes a few trips down the hill we'll know for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Otis_Mom

customer_reviews.title: snowboard
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. No edges. Not nearly as good as the 25 dollar one we already have. Very difficult to hook and unhook feet at the bottom and top of the hill on each run. It is small so the size fits a 5 to 6 yr old and the bindings are much too hard for someone that age to connect. I have to run up and down the hill to help. No fun.
customer_reviews.author: toddmaryland

customer_reviews.title: awesome for sledding hills
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my twin 6 year old boys this season, and they have had a great time on the sledding hill. Their buddy ended up getting one as well since they had so much fun. A great introduction!
customer_reviews.author: Debbi Brennan

customer_reviews.title: good starter
customer_reviews.text: very good for the money go for the 120cm if your kid is taller than 4ft or heavier than 65lbs.
customer_reviews.author: nate l

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GIFT FOR KIDS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson for Christmas and he has completely enjoyed it throughout the Connecticut winter. Just right for younger children wanting to learn to snowboard.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry W. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: good starter
customer_reviews.text: this has been a good starter for my 4yr old. gets him used to balancing while riding. the plastic is not very slick so speed is an issue. waxing the bottom with car wax has helped. keep in mind it is plastic and this is truley the first step to see if your child wants to deal with the pains of snowboarding.i would buy again
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: alright
customer_reviews.text: The decorations started coming off after only a couple uses, and the foot straps are just snug enough to make it annoying to get your feet out. Otherwise it was fine, has the right amount of slide to it.
customer_reviews.author: A. brumm

customer_reviews.title: very good snowboard
customer_reviews.text: Lucky Bums Plastic snowboard slides very well. Our grandsons (ages 5-11) use it on a hilly backyard and have a ball.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S. Raulston

customer_reviews.title: Complete JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: Complete JUNK! The bindings have broken and my son has only used a handful of times. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jessssssssssssss

customer_reviews.title: which is fine for a beginner board
customer_reviews.text: It worked as advertised, and the boot supports are safe and don't lock a child in too firmly, but gives more balance. The plastic of the board makes it a bit slow, which is fine for a beginner board. Others noted it broke quickly, but seems to be sturdy so far.
customer_reviews.author: A. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: this snowboard is durable but easy to use. All of my kids love it. Their feet snap in so they do not slip out when trying to do a jump or move side to side.
customer_reviews.author: Audra Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Great intro to snowboarding!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my 5 year old son to practice on sledding hills and he loves it! Great size and easy to slip their feet into. Nice and light as well, so they can practice jumping and turning. Our 3 year old loves it too!
customer_reviews.author: stephanie towle

customer_reviews.title: Santa was a smarty pants this year
customer_reviews.text: We contemplated buying the crappy intro boards at Target for my six-year-old son. Instead, we bought this snowboard that was great quality and super affordable and we were delighted by it. Santa scored huge with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your
customer_reviews.text: bought twice. received broken binding twice. don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: SEN

customer_reviews.title: I thought it would have been better quality. Not work the money
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. The backs of bindings area cracked right down the middle after two uses. I know it's plastic but for $60, I thought it would have been better quality. Not work the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: only buy if your child is bigfoot
customer_reviews.text: Bindings are way to big. A grown up could put their feet in this thing. Need to have sizes for kids!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Arner

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Daugher loves this board, came in quick and product was as expected. The only issue I have is the binding straps around the heel go not adjust. I don't have any experience with snowboarding and I don't know if this is usual or not.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my kids
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my kids: 7, 5 and 3. Just the right size for them and the buckles are easy to use. The kids can strap themselves and they come off easily. Great first snowboard!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built and undersized
customer_reviews.text: double check your child's snowboard needs....Purchased this for my 8 year old, way undersized. this mirrored an extra large skateboard. Very well built, some of the best bindings on the youth board market. Never got it on the snow, so no ride performance review....all in all if you have a taller child 8 and under this probably is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wahlquist

customer_reviews.title: great beginner snowboard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 7 year old son. I think it lives up to everything they promised with the improvements made. For our backyard use, it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: AAHeart

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but this child's boots would not fit into the boot holds on the board.  Thank you very much.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, but this child's boots would not fit into the boot holds on the board. Thank you very much!
customer_reviews.author: David N. Fenchel

customer_reviews.title: did not stand up to expectations. only used it once and the strap broke on both snowboards that we ordered
customer_reviews.text: would not reconmend this procuct. dont have any other product to compair it with but was very disappointed in the board
customer_reviews.author: Jayne Zens

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it but one of the buckles broke after using it 3 times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The binding broke the first time my son used it.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Clark

customer_reviews.title: Ok for learning snowboarding in your back yard.
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my 9 year old son to learn snowboarding. This board does not have edge, so he could not steer on slope. We tried it on a ski slope. It did not work. If you are thinking about learning snowboard, buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Mariusz Zukowski

customer_reviews.title: VERY disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: Should have taken to heart what previous buyers said. Took this out for the first time Thanksgiving weekend and broke within ONE hour. Discovered bindings on back foot missing necessary pins to secure the top plate for the foot. VERY disappointed in this product. Now I am outside of the 30 day return policy and cannot return for replacement or refund. DO NOT PURCHASE!! not worth the $$ or hassle!!
customer_reviews.author: gilesfam4

customer_reviews.title: Worth 5-stars, but...
customer_reviews.text: I chose to rate this board with 4-stars and not 5-stars, primarily because the caption for 5-stars is "I love it!" I do not love things. I Love God and people...I do not love material possessions. I recommend changing the caption for 5-stars to be something like, "Exceeds all expectations." If Amazon were to change the caption to my suggestion or some close approximation, I would choose to rate products deserving of 5-stars with a 5-star rating. Short of that happening, I will not rate a product with a 5-star rating. This snowboard is worthy of a 5-star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Papa

customer_reviews.title: It is OK
customer_reviews.text: It was OK for my 2 year-old to try out snowboarding. He used if for two seasons, until he was big enough for real snowboarding gear. It is essentially a plastic sled to which you strap your feet, no real edge to turn with. My biggest problem with this item is the bindings. They are made for a far larger foot than an average toddler. In every case I had to stuff items in front of my son's boot to prevent his feet from sliding out.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

product_meta.title: Lucky Bums Kids Beginner Plastic Snowboard, Multiple Colors
product_meta.description: The Lucky Bums Beginner Snowboard is a great choice to introduce kids to snowboarding in the back yard or on the nearby sledding hill. No need to fight to stay in those sandal strap binding designs anymore! The rugged design includes premounted adjustable bindings on a smooth bottom board with a traditional snowboard cut. The 120cm long board has no metal edges and is ideal as a holiday gift for the first time snowboarder. Limited lifetime warranty against material or workmanship defect.
feature_bullets: PERFECT FOR BEGINNERS - Great choice to introduce kids to snowboarding in backyard or on nearby sledding hill.
SMOOTH BOTTOM - Board has traditional snowboard cut, with glossy bottom and gentle edges.
RUGGED DESIGN - Includes pre-mounted adjustable bindings that accommodate snow boots; durable latch system ensures secure fit.
RECOMMENDED AGE - For riders age 9 and up; snowboard does not include metal edges; snowboard not recommended for ski resort use.

SATISFACTION GUARANTEED - When you receive a Lucky Bums product, if you are not 100% satisfied with your purchase, let us know. We are here for our customers and will respond promptly and professionally in order to fix any problems you may have.
